ca.mcgill.ecse211.Navigation

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.Navigation.Navigator

  • public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods to allow the robot to navigate to specified waypoint, or to turn to specific angle. It is mainly called by the Ev3Boot class to navigate to strategic point. It is also called by other LightLocalization class to navigate to a line intersection.
    Author:
    Imad Dodin, An Khang Chau, Chaimae Fahmi

      • getTurnSpeed

        public static int getTurnSpeed()

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo(double x,
                            double y,
                            int treshHold,
                            boolean localizing)
        This method execute navigation to a specific point, if wanted it can light localize upon arrival. First calculate heading correct to point at the arrival point using the odometry current position. Then turn to the calculated heading using turnTo() method. Activate both motors to move forward. In a loop calculate distance between current position and arrival point, if the distance is smaller than treshHold, stop the motors. If the travelled distance since last re-orientation is bigger than a tile size, call orientateTravel() method to re-orient heading to face the arrival point and move forward. This method is called periodically to reset error due to drift. When the distance from arrival point is acceptable stop the motors and light localize if specified.
        Parameters:
        x: - x coordinate to navigate to
        y: - y coordinate to navigate to
        treshHold: - acceptable error distance
        localizing: - should to robot localize upon arrival

      • orientateTravel

        public static void orientateTravel(double x,
                                   double y)
        Method called by "travelTo" method. Re-orient the heading of the robot using the difference between current position and desired position
        Parameters:
        x: - X-coordinate of the arrival point
        y: - Y-coordinate of the arrival point

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo(double theta)
        This method makes the robot turn to the specified bearing. Mainly called by the travelTo() method and LightLocalize() method. In a loop, calculate the difference between current heading and desired heading, if the difference is smaller than "turnError" stop turning and put motors back on forward. Always turn the smallest angle.
        Parameters:
        theta: - Bearing for the robot to readjust its heading to.

      • turnBy

        public static void turnBy(double theta,
                          boolean clockwise,
                          boolean blocking)
        Turn by the specified angle theta, can be both positive or negative
        Parameters:
        clockwise: - true to turn clockwise and false to turn counter clockwise.
        theta: - amount of degree the robot has to turn.
